trans-unit.source: How to Scale an Application
trans-unit.target: How to Scale an Application

trans-unit.source: On the Scale page of the Azure Management Portal, you can manually scale your application or you can set parameters to automatically scale it.
trans-unit.target: On the Scale page of the Azure Management Portal, you can manually scale your application or you can set parameters to automatically scale it.

trans-unit.source: You can scale applications that are running Web Roles, Worker Roles, or Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: You can scale applications that are running Web Roles, Worker Roles, or Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: To scale an application that is running instances of Web Roles or Worker Roles, you add or remove role instances to accommodate the work load.
trans-unit.target: To scale an application that is running instances of Web Roles or Worker Roles, you add or remove role instances to accommodate the work load.

trans-unit.source: When you scale an application up or down that is running Virtual Machines, new machines are not created or deleted, but are turned on or turned off from an availability set of previously created machines.
trans-unit.target: When you scale an application up or down that is running Virtual Machines, new machines are not created or deleted, but are turned on or turned off from an availability set of previously created machines.

trans-unit.source: You can specify scaling based on average percentage of CPU usage or based on the number of messages in a queue.
trans-unit.target: You can specify scaling based on average percentage of CPU usage or based on the number of messages in a queue.

trans-unit.source: You should consider the following information before you configure scaling for your application:
trans-unit.target: You should consider the following information before you configure scaling for your application:

trans-unit.source: You must add Virtual Machines that you create to an availability set to scale an application that uses them.
trans-unit.target: You must add Virtual Machines that you create to an availability set to scale an application that uses them.

trans-unit.source: The Virtual Machines that you add can be initially turned on or turned off, but they will be turned on in a scale-up action and turned off in a scale-down action.
trans-unit.target: The Virtual Machines that you add can be initially turned on or turned off, but they will be turned on in a scale-up action and turned off in a scale-down action.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Virtual Machines and availability sets, see <link><linkText>Manage the Availability of Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Virtual Machines and availability sets, see <link><linkText>Manage the Availability of Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Scaling is affected by core usage.
trans-unit.target: Scaling is affected by core usage.

trans-unit.source: Larger role instances or Virtual Machines use more cores.
trans-unit.target: Larger role instances or Virtual Machines use more cores.

trans-unit.source: You can only scale an application within the limit of cores for your subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can only scale an application within the limit of cores for your subscription.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your subscription has a limit of twenty cores and you run an application with two medium sized Virtual Machines (a total of four cores), you can only scale up other cloud service deployments in your subscription by sixteen cores.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your subscription has a limit of twenty cores and you run an application with two medium sized Virtual Machines (a total of four cores), you can only scale up other cloud service deployments in your subscription by sixteen cores.

trans-unit.source: All Virtual Machines in an availability set that are used in scaling an application must be the same size.
trans-unit.target: All Virtual Machines in an availability set that are used in scaling an application must be the same size.

trans-unit.source: For more information about core usage and machine sizes, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about core usage and machine sizes, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You must create a queue and associate it with a role or availability set before you can scale an application based on a message threshold.
trans-unit.target: You must create a queue and associate it with a role or availability set before you can scale an application based on a message threshold.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to use the Queue Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to use the Queue Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can scale resources that are linked to your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You can scale resources that are linked to your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For more information about linking resources, see <link><linkText>How to: Link a resource to a cloud service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about linking resources, see <link><linkText>How to: Link a resource to a cloud service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To enable high availability of your application, you should ensure that it is deployed with two or more role instances or Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: To enable high availability of your application, you should ensure that it is deployed with two or more role instances or Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Service Level Agreements</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Service Level Agreements</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the Scale page, you can manually increase or decrease the number of running instances in a cloud service.
trans-unit.target: On the Scale page, you can manually increase or decrease the number of running instances in a cloud service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Cloud Services, and then click the name of the cloud service to open the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Cloud Services, and then click the name of the cloud service to open the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Click Scale.
trans-unit.target: Click Scale.

trans-unit.source: Automatic scaling is disabled by default for all roles, which means that you can manually change the number of instances that are used by your application.
trans-unit.target: Automatic scaling is disabled by default for all roles, which means that you can manually change the number of instances that are used by your application.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Each role in the cloud service has a slider for changing the number of instances to use.
trans-unit.target: Each role in the cloud service has a slider for changing the number of instances to use.

trans-unit.source: To add a role instance, drag the bar right.
trans-unit.target: To add a role instance, drag the bar right.

trans-unit.source: To remove an instance, drag the bar left.
trans-unit.target: To remove an instance, drag the bar left.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale role</linkText>

trans-unit.target: You can only increase the number of instances that are used if the appropriate number of cores are available to support the instances.

trans-unit.target: The colors of the slider represent the used and available cores in your subscription:

trans-unit.target: Blue represents the cores that are used by the selected role

trans-unit.target: Dark grey represents the cores that are used by all roles and Virtual Machines in the subscription

trans-unit.target: Light grey represents the cores that are available to use for scaling

trans-unit.target: Pink represents a change made that has not been saved

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Role instances will be added or removed based on your selections.
trans-unit.target: Role instances will be added or removed based on your selections.

trans-unit.source: Automatically scale an application running Web Roles, Worker Roles, or Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Automatically scale an application running Web Roles, Worker Roles, or Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: On the Scale page, you can configure your cloud service to automatically increase or decrease the number of instances or Virtual Machines that are used by your application.
trans-unit.target: On the Scale page, you can configure your cloud service to automatically increase or decrease the number of instances or Virtual Machines that are used by your application.

trans-unit.source: You can configure scaling based on the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can configure scaling based on the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Average CPU usage</linkText><title></title></link> - If the average percentage of CPU usage goes above or below specified thresholds, role instances are created or deleted, or Virtual Machines are are turned on or turned off from an availability set.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Average CPU usage</linkText><title></title></link> - If the average percentage of CPU usage goes above or below specified thresholds, role instances are created or deleted, or Virtual Machines are are turned on or turned off from an availability set.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Queue messages</linkText><title></title></link> - If the number of messages in a queue goes above or below a specified threshold, role instances are created or deleted, or Virtual Machines are are turned on or turned off from an availability set.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Queue messages</linkText><title></title></link> - If the number of messages in a queue goes above or below a specified threshold, role instances are created or deleted, or Virtual Machines are are turned on or turned off from an availability set.

trans-unit.source: You can schedule automatic scaling of your application by configuring schedules for different times.
trans-unit.target: You can schedule automatic scaling of your application by configuring schedules for different times.

trans-unit.source: The following options are available to you for automatic scaling:
trans-unit.target: The following options are available to you for automatic scaling:

trans-unit.source: No schedule - This is the default option and enables your application to be automatically scaled the same way at all times.
trans-unit.target: No schedule - This is the default option and enables your application to be automatically scaled the same way at all times.

trans-unit.source: Day and night - This option enables you to specify scaling for specific times of day and night.
trans-unit.target: Day and night - This option enables you to specify scaling for specific times of day and night.

trans-unit.source: Note: Schedules are currently not available for applications that use Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Note: Schedules are currently not available for applications that use Virtual Machines.
